cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest tonight, then bending northwest Monday toward the central Louisiana coast, passing very near the Mississippi River Delta and Metropolitan New Orleans before sliding westward along the coast through Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near the mouth of the Mississippi River – roughly between Morgan City and Buras, south of New Orleans

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, plus Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border, Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Metropolitan New Orleans, and Cameron to west of Morgan City
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southeast Louisiana coastline, including Mississippi River Delta and adjacent Mississippi coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (2–4 ft in Lake Pontchartrain; 3–5 ft mouth of Mississippi)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible during closest approach Monday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Lake Pontchartrain and along the Mississippi River levee system; locally 3–5 ft near the river’s mouth.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 7 inches, producing flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday–Monday night; dangerous seas and rip currents affecting vessel operations; potential brief river level rises due to surge.
